alert.note: Alert for Adams; Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 5:59AM CST until December 15 at 7:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Winter Storm Impacts Today Through Thursday... A wintry mix continues in north-central Wisconsin this morning with multiple rounds of precipitation persisting into Thursday. Icing, especially on elevated surfaces such as bridges, may result in slippery to hazardous driving conditions combined with tree damage from winds gusting near 45 mph. This wintry mix will alleviate midday before another round of snow develops tonight. Several inches of snow are possible Wednesday night in north- central Wisconsin. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches with ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Juneau and Adams Counties. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 7 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
